intro: Allantodia baishanzuensis, commonly known as the Baishanzu Allantodia, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. It is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
